The image of their father doting on the AI tiger instead of nagging him brought a satisfied smirk to Lucas's face.

After brief consideration, Evelyn nodded. With her upcoming commitments at Kingsley Tech, she wouldn't have time for Leo anyway. Having her family care for him was the perfect solution.

Lucas practically bounced with excitement, his cheerful demeanor a complete contrast to the intimidating presence he'd shown the reporter moments ago.

"Perfect! You go handle your meeting then—"

To Evelyn's astonishment, Lucas effortlessly accessed her penthouse using biometrics she didn't remember granting him, immediately scooping up the mechanical tiger in a bear hug.

"I definitely didn't authorize his fingerprints," Evelyn muttered, shaking her head.

Kingsley Tech Headquarters

Harrison rushed into Nathan's office with urgent news. The internet was ablaze with a viral video showing Evelyn's fiery confrontation with reporters. Her stunning beauty, razor-sharp wit, and unshakable confidence had captivated the online world.

[QUEEN BEHAVIOR! Evelyn doesn't owe anyone explanations!]
[Vanessa's the one who should be ashamed, not our CEO!]
[That car did the world a favor hitting that manipulative witch!]
[Lucas is absolute husband material! Shame he only got one line...]

The temperature in the room seemed to drop several degrees. Harrison swallowed hard before continuing. "Perhaps they were... overzealous? The public can't get enough of you and Evelyn's story."

Nathan's piercing gaze made Harrison instantly regret his choice of words. "Perhaps?"

The video showed Evelyn's initial vulnerability before Lucas arrived, and how her confidence grew with her brother's support. Harrison could practically feel Nathan's rage radiating through the room.

"Ms. Sinclair isn't being disturbed anymore," Harrison quickly assured him. "Everything's under control now."

Nathan's responding glare could have frozen lava.

Within minutes, Harrison's shirt was soaked with sweat. As Nathan's most trusted assistant, he still couldn't comprehend why his boss had become so invested in Evelyn's affairs post-divorce.

During their three-year marriage, Nathan had shown little interest. Why this sudden obsession after their separation?

At Kingsley Tech, the collaborative project was progressing smoothly. The initial phase required daily meetings between all parties to adjust strategies based on real-time developments.

Still shaken from her earlier car accident, Evelyn opted to take the company car rather than drive herself.

As she arrived at Kingsley Tech, a familiar Range Rover caught her eye across the street.

Its owner stood tall and imposing, his chiseled features set in their usual cold expression. The air around him seemed to crackle with restrained energy.

Evelyn pretended not to notice him as she stepped out of her car. Her emerald green halter dress accentuated her graceful figure while projecting an air of quiet authority.

Nathan moved to intercept her, desperate to explain that he hadn't orchestrated the media ambush. He couldn't bear the thought of her misunderstanding his intentions.

But Evelyn walked past without sparing him a glance, her head held high as she entered the building alone.
###Chapter 138

Evelyn Sinclair didn't so much as glance in Nathan Blackwood's direction.

Not only did she refuse to acknowledge him, she walked straight past him into Kingsley Tech's lobby with her designer bag clutched tightly in hand.

Every inch of her - from her stiletto heels to the way she tossed her hair - radiated deliberate indifference toward Nathan.

The security guard immediately sprang to open the glass doors for her.

"Thank you," she murmured politely before striding inside without hesitation.

Nathan's brow furrowed as he watched her. Her blatant disregard made his chest constrict painfully.

She truly doesn't give a damn about me anymore. I can't read her at all. The realization hit him like a physical blow.

Nathan's expression darkened dangerously as he stood frozen in place.

The man immediately shrank back under the intensity of that stare.

The chaotic scene continued as reporters shouted over each other.

Kingsley Tech's security team quickly intervened, creating a path through the media frenzy.

Nathan didn't move. His voice cut through the noise like ice. "If any of you dare approach me again, I'll ensure you never work in this industry again." His threats were never empty.

An eerie silence fell over the crowd. No one dared breathe too loudly, exchanging nervous glances. Even the reporter who'd accepted Lucas Sterling's bribe kept his mouth shut.

Up on the second-floor balcony, Evelyn leaned casually against the railing, observing the scene below. Nathan's reaction was predictable - always so composed, always so intimidating.

That overwhelming presence was exactly what made him such a formidable CEO.

The man could shake all of New York with a single step.

Evelyn's lips twisted downward.

No matter how much Nathan doted on Vanessa Holloway, the woman would always be branded a homewrecker.

And Evelyn had prepared a special surprise for her.

Nathan's gaze suddenly lifted, locking onto Evelyn's position. Their eyes met across the crowded lobby, an electric current passing between them.

Evelyn's frown transformed into a smirk. She raised one perfectly arched brow in undisguised amusement. Enjoying the show?

Nathan's dark eyes burned into hers. Evelyn straightened, clicking her heels against the marble floor. She silently mouthed three words before turning away.

No one else seemed to notice.

The reporters were finally ejected, restoring calm to the entrance.

Dominic Kingsley emerged from his office to greet them.

Nathan remained rooted in place, still processing what he'd seen.

She'd clearly mouthed: "Karma's a bitch."

Evelyn disappeared into the conference room. Nathan eventually followed.

Once seated across from each other, the project manager began presenting updates.

When the presentation concluded, Dominic Kingsley cleared his throat.

"With the preliminary phase wrapping up, we should discuss the pilot location. Urban setting or suburban? I'd like your thoughts."

"The suburbs," Nathan stated firmly. "AI technology still needs refinement. An accident would be easier to contain outside city limits."

Evelyn cut in sharply. "If the AI is meant for urban implementation, testing in an unfamiliar environment defeats the purpose."

"You seem determined to oppose me at every turn," Nathan observed dryly.

Why else would she consistently challenge his suggestions?

Evelyn gave a derisive laugh, meeting his gaze with icy detachment. "Mr. Blackwood, you can drop the 'seem to be.'"
###Chapter 139 Cheating Scum Deserve Hell

Nathan Blackwood's relentless harm toward Evelyn Sinclair had cemented her hostility against him permanently.

###Chapter 141

Sophia Blackwood never anticipated her impulsive act would wreak such havoc on Blackwood Enterprises while Evelyn Sinclair, her intended target, remained unscathed.

###Chapter 142

###Chapter 143

###Chapter 144

###Chapter 145

"That homewrecker tried to murder his ex-wife? What kind of monster is she? Who does she think she is?"

"Blackwood Enterprises' stock took quite a hit, didn't it?"

The next trending topic featured Lucas Sterling enjoying the drama unfold online.

Using his verified account, Lucas reposted Horizon Media's explosive report.

His caption read: "Karma's a bitch! @EvelynSinclair I know you're too classy for this, but let me fan the flames for you!"

"OMG is this Lucas publicly declaring his love for Evelyn?" "Let's all add fuel to the fire! Team Evelyn!"

"Everyone knows Lucas has a crush on Evelyn, but this feels so extra. Hilarious though!"

"Credit to Lucas for having good taste, but our CEO Evelyn should remain the ultimate independent queen!"

Lucas's public stance was clearly an act of protection and undisguised favoritism toward Evelyn.

This was unprecedented in celebrity culture.

Had Lucas been just another actor, his comments wouldn't have caused such a stir.

But Lucas Sterling was Hollywood royalty.

His every word carried weight.

The moment he spoke, his millions of followers rallied behind Evelyn.

Naturally, Vanessa and Nathan faced even harsher backlash.

Evelyn smirked, thinking they deserved every bit of it.

Blackwood Enterprises' stock dip, while significant, barely made a dent in the family's fortune.

Evelyn had long stopped caring about them.

Three hours later, Blackwood Enterprises issued a statement.

"Mr. Nathan Blackwood and Ms. Vanessa Holloway maintain a strictly professional relationship. Our company will pursue all legal avenues to protect Mr. Blackwood's reputation."

They attached a cease-and-desist letter.

Their efforts to control the narrative failed spectacularly.

Their PR team was embarrassingly incompetent.

When news broke about Evelyn's near-death experience, the Sterling family erupted.

William Sterling pulled strings to ensure Vanessa would serve her full sentence without parole.

Alexander Sterling ordered Evelyn to take medical leave, insisting the company could manage without her.

Donovan Sterling, relieved his sister was alive, remained characteristically quiet.

Lucas Sterling unleashed a torrent of profanity across social media.

"President Sinclair, Ms. Blackwood is here to see you."

Evelyn paused. "Sophia Blackwood?" Bennett nodded.

"What does she want now? Didn't she learn her lesson last time?" Evelyn's lips curled into a dangerous smile.

She leaned back in her leather chair, arching one perfect eyebrow. "Send her in."

"Yes, ma'am."

Moments later, Sophia strutted in on stiletto heels.

Her haggard appearance suggested she hadn't been sleeping well.

Given Old Master Blackwood's temperament, family loyalty meant nothing when business interests were at stake.

Sophia still hadn't learned this crucial lesson.

"Evelyn, you really think you're untouchable now, don't you?"

Sophia's envious gaze swept across the luxurious office.

Evelyn's expression remained icy. "My time is valuable, Ms. Blackwood. State your business."

She had no patience for petty games with lesser women.

Sophia's face twisted in displeasure. Who did Evelyn think she was?

But remembering her grandfather's threats, Sophia swallowed her pride.

She lifted her chin in that trademark Blackwood arrogance. "I came to apologize."

As if Evelyn should feel honored. When had a Blackwood ever apologized to anyone?

If not for Evelyn's counterattack damaging their company, Old Master Blackwood would never have forced this humiliation.

Evelyn studied Sophia and burst into laughter.

Sophia looked ready for war, not reconciliation. Did she think Evelyn was stupid?

"What's so funny? Stop gloating! I wouldn't be here if Grandpa hadn't ordered—"

Evelyn's smile vanished. "Nobody forced you. If you're unhappy, the door's right there."
###Chapter 146

Evelyn's lips curled into a cold smirk. Did Sophia truly believe she could be fooled so easily? As if a half-hearted apology from her would mean anything?

She wouldn’t care even if Sophia groveled at her feet.

Her punishment? Another night kneeling in the ancestral hall.

She looked every bit the untouchable goddess.

One glance told Evelyn everything—arrogant, entitled, and utterly useless.

"Ms. Sterling," he drawled, flashing a smarmy smile. "I’ve heard so much about you. You’re even more stunning in person."

Evelyn barely spared him a glance, offering only a curt nod.

She didn’t know him. She didn’t care to.

And his attempt at flattery was painfully unoriginal.

His smile faltered at her indifference. He had come here hoping to impress Nathan Blackwood, who was upstairs with his friends, brooding over Sterling Corporation’s recent victories.

Seeing Nathan’s dark mood, this fool thought he could win favor by putting Evelyn in her place.

Maybe if he succeeded, Nathan would even consider a business deal with his family.

The thought emboldened him.

Her refusal was absolute. She wouldn’t accept anything from a man like him.

Evelyn finally met his eyes, her gaze sharp enough to cut glass.

"Yes."
###Chapter 147: A Lesson in Humility

Beneath that powerful CEO facade, she was just a fragile woman.

Who does this pathetic man think he is? He’s not even worth my breath.

Nathan Blackwood.

Anson’s family was small-time in San Francisco.

Did he really just try to lay hands on Evelyn Sinclair?
###Chapter 148

The crowd gasped in shock.

Rumors had been swirling for months about the bitter feud between Nathan Blackwood and Evelyn Sinclair.

So why did this ex-husband suddenly leap to her defense when danger struck?

She had been ready for this.

With her martial arts training, that spoiled rich boy wouldn't have stood a chance against her.

Nathan's intervention had been... unexpected.

His blood ran cold.

Nathan was hopelessly in love with his ex-wife.

Even if Nathan himself hadn't realized it yet.

So Tristan would be damned if he let some third-rate social climber ruin things.

During Nathan and Evelyn's forced marriage, Tristan had made Evelyn's life miserable.

He was no better than Anson.

###Chapter 149

Evelyn Sinclair smirked from the sidelines, thinking what an absolutely spectacular show this had turned out to be.

Though truth be told, she'd had enough of this ridiculous performance.

Every additional second spent watching these fools was a complete waste of her precious time.

The only person she wanted to avoid more than anyone else was Nathan Blackwood.

Let them keep watching Nathan's pathetic little show, she thought bitterly.

Guilt and remorse weighed heavily on him, and he desperately wanted Evelyn to give him just one chance to make things right.

With Vanessa out of the picture and their misunderstandings cleared, Nathan felt even more ashamed of how he'd treated Evelyn now that he saw Vanessa's true colors.

Friendship? Evelyn wouldn't even acknowledge him if they passed on the street.

Wasn't that the case? He'd already explained he had nothing to do with Vanessa. Why was he still worthless in Evelyn's eyes? Was there truly no chance for reconciliation between them?

How utterly ironic.

Was it just to prove your moral superiority?" Her voice dripped with disdain. "Don't insult me by talking about friendship. Why should I care? I was the one who donated blood. This was never about Vanessa Holloway - it's always been about you, Nathan Blackwood!"

By the time she finished speaking, all traces of amusement had vanished from Evelyn's face, replaced by an arctic chill in her piercing gaze.

Nathan Blackwood had single-handedly destroyed every ounce of affection she'd ever felt for him.

Did he really expect her to feel grateful and come running back just because he claimed innocence regarding Vanessa? In his dreams!

Without so much as another glance in his direction, Evelyn turned and walked away, her heels clicking decisively against the pavement.

Nathan stood frozen in place, the bone-deep coldness radiating from Evelyn seeping into his very soul.

Am I truly so unworthy to even speak to her? The thought cut deeper than he cared to admit.

For the first time, Nathan realized Evelyn had completely slipped from his control - perhaps even beyond his reach entirely.

This unsettling realization sent an unexpected pang of panic through him.

Isabella's luxury sedan idled nearby, waiting for Evelyn.

As she slid into the passenger seat and buckled her seatbelt with mechanical precision, her face remained an impassive mask.

Isabella spotted Nathan still standing there and snorted derisively. "What does he want now?"

Evelyn's lips twisted wryly. "He wants to be friends."

A harsh laugh escaped Isabella. "Is he delusional? After everything?"

"Obviously." Evelyn's tone dripped with sarcasm as she watched Nathan's retreating figure grow smaller in the side mirror, suddenly feeling the entire encounter had been utterly pointless.

The moment Evelyn arrived home, she immediately called Bennett.

Her voice held an uncharacteristic edge as she issued her command: "There's some spoiled trust fund brat named Anson. I don't care what his family business is, but I want to wake up tomorrow to news of their complete financial ruin and disappearance from high society."

Bennett had no idea what had transpired earlier that evening, but this marked the first time Evelyn had ever used Sterling Corporation's influence to deliberately destroy another company.

"Understood, President Sinclair."

Bennett sighed internally. Looks like another all-nighter for me...
###Chapter 150

I’ll endure anything if it means she doesn’t destroy me next.

Breathe through it.

Damn, she sees right through me.

How the mighty have fallen.
###Chapter 151 A Death Wish?

###Chapter 152 Only You Are Worthy

Cassandra Delacroix had just returned to Montecito and decided to attend the auction for some entertainment.

Three years ago, Evelyn Sinclair had stolen her chance with Nathan. Now, Cassandra refused to back down.

She meant she could sit wherever she pleased.

But Nathan wasn’t interested.

"$250,000!"

Evelyn decided to step in. Since he had accompanied her, she would show her appreciation.

"$700,000," she called.

Evelyn’s lips curved. Does she really think she can outbid me?

Cassandra’s face fell—she didn’t have that kind of spending money. Her resentment toward Evelyn flared.

Just as the auctioneer prepared to finalize Evelyn’s bid, a deep voice cut through the room.

"$1.1 million."

Nathan.

The cufflinks weren’t worth that much, but they were the last missing piece in his Laurent Dubois collection. He needed them.

The crowd buzzed—ex-wife versus ex-husband. Who would win?

Evelyn didn’t hesitate. "$1.2 million."

Julian leaned in. "Ms. Sinclair, they’re not worth that much."

She smiled but didn’t respond.

Nathan countered immediately. "$1.5 million."

His gaze flicked toward Evelyn, but she wasn’t looking at him—her focus was entirely on the cufflinks, an almost obsessive desire in her eyes.

Without pause, she raised her paddle again.

"Two million."

The auctioneer’s voice rang out. "Two million, going once! Two million, going twice—"

He deliberately dragged out the pause, waiting to see if Nathan would bid again.
###Chapter 153 A Change of Attire

The auction hall fell into stunned silence. To everyone's astonishment, Nathan Blackwood subtly averted his gaze and ceased his bidding.

If she desires it that badly, let her have it. Nathan mused silently. The auctioneer's gavel struck decisively. "Sold for two million dollars!"

Murmurs rippled through the crowd. Had the formidable Mr. Blackwood actually conceded? The anticipated showdown had ended far too abruptly.

Evelyn Sinclair's lips curled in a cold smirk. This piece isn't worth nearly that much. Nathan deliberately inflated the price just to make me overspend.

She rose gracefully, Julian Moreau shadowing her steps as they moved to complete the transaction. Neither noticed the dark figure observing them from the shadows.

Presenting the exquisite cufflinks to Julian, Evelyn smiled. "These are for you."

Julian's eyes widened comically. "For me? But these cost two million!" His voice cracked slightly.

Collateral damage.

Publicly humiliated.

Not acquainted.

Let the world see what a shameless woman Evelyn Sinclair is.

###Chapter 156 The Empty Fuel Tank

###Chapter 157 No Strings Attached

Warmth.

###Chapter 162 Her Father Wouldn't Dare

"Get lost!" Evelyn shot back, her cheeks flushing. Dominic had spent too much time with Lucas - they'd both developed the same infuriating habit of teasing her.

Business concluded, Evelyn strode away in her designer heels. Any longer and she might have punched someone.

Within minutes, the recording went viral, dethroning the "sugar mama" scandal as the top trending topic.

Cassandra hadn't even made it back to Celestial Media to complain to her father before the internet exploded with investigations into "Ms. Sinclair." Soon, Cassandra's own dirty laundry began surfacing.
###Chapter 163 Evelyn Sinclair's Favorite

Cassandra Delacroix had been expelled from high school for bullying classmates and was shipped off to Europe for a year of "character rehabilitation."

When Cassandra returned to Montecito, she became obsessed with Nathan Blackwood, but her confession ended in brutal rejection. Undeterred, she flew to Seoul for extensive plastic surgery, leaving none of her original features intact.

The moment Cassandra caught wind of Nathan's divorce, she rushed back to Montecito like a storm.

But what truly set the internet ablaze was the second half of that leaked recording:

"Ms. Delacroix, is this all because of Nathan Blackwood? I don’t make a habit of revisiting discarded trash."

(OMG! The sheer audacity! Queen Evelyn is unstoppable!)

(With a fortune like hers, why would she waste time on an ex? Fresh talent is way more exciting!)

(Thank you, Ms. Sinclair, for noticing our Julian! He deserves the world!)

(Cassandra is pathetic. She should crawl back into whatever hole she came from.)

(Evelyn’s dominance is everything. Forever my idol!)

(Age is just a number, but youth? Irresistible. Evelyn knows what she wants!)

The aftermath? The world now believed Evelyn Sinclair had a soft spot for gorgeous young men.

Blackwood Enterprises

The air in Nathan’s office turned glacial.

Silence.

Nathan’s expression was thunderous, his aura so oppressive that Harrison nearly flinched.

Harrison had seen the news at dawn and reported it immediately. But before they could react, public opinion had already shifted.

At first, people mocked Evelyn for being Julian’s "sugar mommy." Now? They praised her for having impeccable taste.

Harrison had never felt minutes drag so painfully.

Nathan’s fury was a living thing, suffocating the room.

He scrolled through the comments, jaw clenched. Some fans had even edited clips of Evelyn and Julian, adding romantic music as if they were the next power couple.

Julian, the rising star. Nathan, the "overpowered has-been."

With a snarl, Nathan hurled his phone against the wall. The screen shattered.

Harrison stiffened.

Nathan’s voice was razor-sharp. "Don’t these people have jobs? ‘Young hunk’? He looks like a child! How is that compatibility?"

Harrison swallowed. "Julian’s fans are delusional. There’s no way Ms. Sinclair would seriously entertain him. He’s just using her for clout."

Internally, he sighed. Why does he even care? They’re divorced.

Nathan’s mind circled back to Evelyn’s words—discarded trash.

Was that meant for him?

His grip tightened.

"Then what," Nathan bit out, "do you think Evelyn actually likes?"

Harrison hesitated.

Nathan’s glare darkened. That night, she smiled at Harrison more in five minutes than she ever did at me in years.

Why?

The bitterness in his chest was impossible to ignore.
###Chapter 164 The Type She Likes

For a brief moment, Harrison felt as though an unseen force had lifted him from his chair by the collar of his shirt.

The suffocating tension in the room was unbearable.

Nathan Blackwood's piercing gaze darkened when Harrison remained silent.

"You two are close, aren't you?" Nathan's voice was deceptively calm, each word laced with lethal precision. "Tell me, what kind of man does she prefer?"

Harrison swallowed hard. If he didn't answer, he wasn’t sure he’d leave this office unscathed.

Working for Nathan had always been dangerous, but today felt like walking a tightrope over a pit of vipers.

"Mr. Blackwood, I wouldn’t say I’m particularly close to Ms. Sinclair. How would I know her preferences?"

That was too close.

"Ensure Kingsley Tech’s event goes flawlessly. No mistakes."

How dare they compare that nobody to me? Are the public blind?

Across the city, the media frenzy had reached a fever pitch.

Evelyn Sinclair and Julian Moreau’s rumored relationship had become the nation’s hottest topic. Though neither had confirmed anything, fans had already paired them together.

Meanwhile, Lucas Sterling’s social media was flooded with messages—some sympathizing, others offering advice on how to win Evelyn back.

A few even urged him to move on.

The joint project between Kingsley Tech, Sterling Corporation, and Blackwood Industries had already drawn massive attention.

Now, the three companies were holding a high-profile press conference, instantly dominating headlines.

Every major news outlet scrambled for details, but Dominic Kingsley had kept everything tightly under wraps.

By the time the event began, three hundred journalists packed the venue, buzzing with anticipation.

At the appointed hour, Dominic Kingsley, Nathan Blackwood, and Evelyn Sinclair appeared together on stage.

Evelyn, standing between the two powerful men, commanded attention effortlessly. Her poise was regal, her beauty undeniable.

She was born to stand at the pinnacle, untouchable.

Dominic looked impeccable in his tailored smoky-gray suit, exuding quiet authority.

Nathan, in his signature black ensemble, was the epitome of cold elegance—untouchable, formidable.

The trio’s presence alone eclipsed every celebrity in the room. Had they chosen entertainment over business, they would’ve dominated the industry.

Though the internet buzzed with speculation about Nathan and Evelyn’s relationship, no one dared broach the subject today.

This was far too serious an occasion for gossip.

"Let’s begin."
###Chapter 165 Personal Question

The entire presentation was dominated by Dominic Kingsley's articulate explanation of the revolutionary AI chip, which he proudly named Aether Core.

I should have focused on my career from the start.

A diplomatic answer—one that left room for interpretation.

Admire, not desire. They should know the difference.

Evelyn froze.

She lowered the window just enough.

###Chapter 166 Transfer Funds to Mr. Blackwood

The air inside the luxury sedan turned thick with tension.

###Chapter 167 Not Necessarily Yours

###Chapter 168 Is This Your Worth?

###Chapter 169 I Hit You on Purpose

Evelyn now controlled Celestial Media as its majority shareholder.

Nathan Blackwood.

Of course. He owns half a dozen identical cars.

###Chapter 170 Private Settlement?

###Chapter 171 As Long as You Both Remarry

Missus?

That's what he still called her?

Missus.

Yet Nathan had thrown it away.

How could the old man not be furious?

If Evelyn wanted the company, she could have it.

If that was the case… perhaps it wasn’t entirely foolish.

His expression softened marginally. "Floyd—William Sterling—won’t forgive us easily. But an outright war benefits no one. He’s holding back—for now."

A union between Sterling Corporation and Blackwood Corporation would be unstoppable.

The perfect alliance.

The ideal outcome.

Nathan’s expression darkened. He lifted his eyes to his grandfather.

"She won’t agree to a marriage of convenience."

Especially not with me.
###Chapter 172 Marry Another Person

If Evelyn Sinclair had ever considered a marriage of convenience, she wouldn't have hidden her true identity all these years. What she sought was far more than just a contractual union.

Old Master Blackwood scoffed bitterly. "Would you stand by and watch her marry someone else? Think of what our family stands to lose!" His wrinkled fingers tightened around his cane. "There's no better match for Evelyn than you, Nathan."

No matter who Evelyn chose in the future, the Blackwood name would become a laughingstock. The damage to their reputation would be irreparable.

Though Old Master Blackwood didn't particularly like Evelyn, he couldn't ignore the immense power and influence of the Sterling family behind her.

Nathan's expression darkened at his grandfather's words. The mere thought of Evelyn with another man made his jaw clench involuntarily. He'd never allowed himself to consider that possibility.

"Unacceptable," Nathan growled through gritted teeth.

Only then could they counter the Sterling family's growing influence. Nathan's entire body tensed, his knuckles turning white with suppressed anger.

The suggestion filled him with visceral disgust. His gaze turned glacial as he met his grandfather's stare. "I don't need an arranged marriage."

"This isn't your decision to make—"

"I'll handle my affairs with the Sterlings myself." Nathan cut him off sharply, already turning toward the door. His relationship with Evelyn was complicated enough without introducing another woman into the mix.

Nathan's dangerous glare silenced her mid-sentence. "How many times must I warn you, Sophia? Stay away from Evelyn." His voice dropped to a deadly whisper. "Apparently my warnings mean nothing to you."

Sophia paled, shrinking back against the wall. "I-I didn't—"

Sophia's mouth opened and closed soundlessly.

As Nathan strode out of Aspen Lodge, Sophia remained frozen, a cold sweat breaking across her brow.

Inside his car, Nathan replayed his grandfather's words. The image of Evelyn in another man's arms made his stomach churn. An invisible weight pressed against his chest, making each breath feel labored.

Before he realized what he was doing, his fingers had dialed Evelyn's number. The word "Wife" still displayed on his screen—a relic from happier times. To his relief, the call connected. She hadn't blocked him again.

That small mercy eased some of the tension in his shoulders.

Evelyn answered after three rings, her voice thick with sleep. "Hello?"

No trace of their usual animosity colored her tone. For a fleeting moment, it felt like old times.

"It's me," Nathan said quietly.

The change was instantaneous. Evelyn's voice turned to ice. "Have you calculated the repair costs? Just tell me how much I owe you." Her eagerness to sever all ties cut deeper than he expected.

Nathan's grip tightened on the phone. "Wrong number," he lied smoothly. "My apologies."

He heard her sharp intake of breath before she hissed, "You absolute lunatic!" The line went dead.

Nathan stared at his phone, an unexpected chuckle escaping his lips. Only Evelyn could hang up on him and leave him smiling.

The mighty CEO of Blackwood Corporation, reduced to finding amusement in being dismissed by a woman. The business world would never believe it.
###Chapter 173 Make It Happen.

Morning light streamed through Evelyn's penthouse windows as she prepared for work.

With Kingsley Tech's project running smoothly, she turned her attention to a new real estate venture.

Checking social media, she found netizens divided between shipping her with Lucas Sterling or Julian Moreau.

A minority paired her with Nathan, trailing far behind.

Evelyn laughed. "At least the public knows Nathan and I don't belong together!"

Bennett hesitated. "Should we remove these posts?"

"No harm in letting them play," Evelyn said. "It's not like I'll date whoever wins this silly poll."

She couldn't possibly date Lucas - revealing their sibling relationship would cause chaos!

Nathan scowled at the polls. "How do these nobodies rank higher than me? The public's taste is trash!"

He slammed his tablet down.

Within hours, the "Nathan-Evelyn" pairing skyrocketed past the others.

In Evelyn's group chat:

[Isabella Montgomery: Insider says Blackwood bought those trending spots! Is Nathan insane?]
[Natalie Beaumont: Wow... just wow...]
[Sebastian Hart: Why isn't MY name there??]

[Evelyn Sinclair: He's definitely lost it.]

Evelyn immediately called Bennett. "Take it down. Double whatever Nathan paid."

The polls vanished instantly.

When informed, Nathan simply said, "Good."
###Chapter 174 Make Another Appointment

Evelyn Sinclair had a mountain of work piling up on her desk.

The Pacific Heights Project was hitting unexpected roadblocks.

Maxwell Thornton, their primary developer, had suddenly backed out of their agreed-upon price at the eleventh hour.

He demanded a 30% increase on top of their original deal. Naturally, Evelyn refused. This project was Sterling Corporation’s crown jewel in real estate—failure wasn’t an option.

Her negotiation team returned empty-handed. Maxwell remained stubborn, unwilling to budge.

Every day of delay cost Sterling Corp millions. With Alexander Sterling overseas for inspections, the burden fell squarely on Evelyn’s shoulders.

Flipping through past meeting notes, Evelyn frowned. Something didn’t add up.

Why the sudden shift in attitude?

Bennett, standing nearby, cleared his throat. "I did some digging."

"Apparently, someone approached Maxwell—promised him better deals and higher commissions."

"He’s using this as leverage to squeeze more out of us."

Evelyn’s fingers stilled. "Who?"

Finding another developer overseas would be costly and time-consuming. They were stuck dealing with Maxwell.

She wouldn’t let anyone manipulate her.

Bennett nodded. "Right away."

Maxwell accepted the invitation almost instantly—as if he’d been waiting for it.

Evelyn arrived precisely on time. Maxwell, however, strolled in fifteen minutes late.

Her patience was already thin. His smug smirk as he apologized only made it worse.

Evelyn paused, her gaze icy.

Maxwell’s expression darkened. He leaned forward, dropping his trump card.

He expected her to cave. Women, in his experience, folded under pressure.

Evelyn merely laughed.

She turned on her heel.

If this mystery investor truly existed, why was Maxwell still negotiating? Evelyn wasn’t buying it.

But she was curious who was pulling his strings.

An hour later, her phone buzzed.

Bennett’s voice was tense. "President, Maxwell just met with Reginald Sinclair and Nathan Blackwood at the Aurora Club."

Silence.

Then—

"Interesting."
###Chapter 175 Hollywood Heartthrob

After a brief pause, Evelyn's composed voice responded through the phone, "Understood."

Their golden era had passed, leaving them barely clinging to relevance. Yet despite their decline, they still commanded respect and remained superior to many competitors.

When Penelope learned of Yuna's celebrity aspirations, she'd eagerly facilitated introductions to influential directors, promising industry access.

Evelyn arched an eyebrow. Few dared address her this way. This rookie had audacity.

So this was about Lucas? Evelyn frowned. "Not your concern."

Evelyn's eyes turned glacial. "Is that so? I'll have to verify that." She pulled out her phone. "Lucas, I'm drunk. Pick me up. And bring flats." She hung up without waiting.

Blackwood Enterprises.

Reginald gaped.

"His deputy has coveted his position for years."

She let the revelation hang between them.
"The man gladly offered me a ten percent discount."

Reginald's knees nearly buckled.
Maxwell looked ready to vomit.

Evelyn tilted her head.
"Brutal world, isn't it, gentlemen?"
"Winning really is everything."

Bennett already held the car door open.
As Evelyn slid inside, Maxwell clawed at the window.

"Twenty percent discount! No—thirty!"
He'd work for free if she demanded it.

But the tinted window rose without hesitation.
The engine purred to life.

Evelyn didn't glance back.
Fools should've considered consequences before crossing her.
###Chapter 182 She Bought You a Present

The scandal surrounding Penelope Sinclair exploded across social media within hours.

No one could believe the usually poised A-list actress would stoop to such desperate measures.

What infuriated the public most was how Penelope had tried manipulating them. The backlash was brutal.

Netizens reveled in her downfall as sponsorships evaporated overnight. Breach of contract penalties piled up.

With no way to salvage her reputation, Penelope had no choice but to issue a public apology.

She posted a tearful video announcing her retirement from Hollywood to focus on the Sinclair family business.

The internet immediately dug into her privileged upbringing, uncovering more scandals. Evelyn was surprised by how quickly Penelope folded.

It was a smart tactical retreat - preserving some dignity before completely burning her fanbase. Meanwhile, Sebastian Hart's birthday approached.

Every year, Natalie and Isabella would compete to find the most extravagant gift for the dashing bachelor. Evelyn never stressed - Sebastian adored anything from her.

###Chapter 183 The Ring She Gave Him

Memories surfaced of Evelyn's hopeful expressions before their divorce, her subtle hints about celebrating together. He'd always brushed her off, preferring distance between them.

The search proved futile. Years-old garments wouldn't remain in rotation. Housekeeping would have found any jewelry during regular cleanings.

The realization of his past neglect carved a hollow space beneath his sternum. That ring - Evelyn must have chosen it with such hope, such vulnerability.

And he'd lost it without a second thought.

###Chapter 184 The Missing Date

Evelyn exchanged glances with Natalie before nodding. "By all means."
