"Too sweet."

No filter. Evelyn shot her a look, but Natalie was already scrutinizing Preston.

Preston finished buttoning Evelyn’s coat and turned to Natalie with a smile. "You haven’t eaten, right? I’ll grab food so Ms. Montgomery can eat when she wakes."

Under normal circumstances, they’d have refused.

What shops were open at this hour?

Sending him out would just inconvenience him.

But he’d mentioned Isabella—how she’d refused meals at Donovan’s place. She was probably starving.

Evelyn nodded. "Don’t go far. Just get whatever’s available. If nothing’s open, come back. I’ll have the butler send something."

Preston smiled and left. Natalie shook her head.

"Mr. Sinclair is so attentive with you. But be careful. Don’t let temporary sweetness blind you like Isabella did."

Evelyn chuckled. "I know. He’s not that type."

Natalie frowned, holding back words.

Evelyn wasn’t Isabella.

And Preston wasn’t Donovan.

The doctor wheeled Isabella back into the ward. Her face was swollen, red as a boiled lobster—pitiful.

"Doctor, how is she?"
###Chapter 943

The doctor's lips curved into a reassuring smile. "Ms. Montgomery's vitals are stable, though traces of the injected substances remain in her system. Full recovery should take approximately eight to nine hours. She's running a slight fever, but the medication we administered will reduce it shortly."

Evelyn Sinclair and Natalie Beaumont exchanged relieved glances.

Their timely intervention had clearly made the difference.

Once the medical staff departed, the two women settled into chairs beside Isabella's hospital bed, observing their friend's restless state.

Even unconscious, Isabella was muttering curses directed at Donovan Pierce. Words like "filthy bastard" and "rot in hell" slipped through her feverish lips.

Evelyn and Natalie shared an amused look. Most people would be devastated after such an ordeal. But not Isabella Montgomery - her mind immediately turned to vengeance!

Less than thirty minutes later, Preston Sinclair returned bearing food.

Evelyn noted the distinctive packaging from Le Ciel Privé - an exclusive eatery where reservations typically required months of advance notice. Yet Preston had somehow convinced them to prepare a midnight meal?

Before she could voice her surprise, Natalie's sharp eyes caught the logo. "Isn't this place booked solid for the next six months? How did you manage this?"

Preston's expression remained composed, though warmth flickered in his gaze. "Everyone's been through an ordeal tonight, especially our patient here. I thought you all deserved proper sustenance." He set the containers on the side table. "The owner happens to be an old friend. Made two portions - one for when Ms. Montgomery wakes, and another for you ladies now."

Evelyn couldn't help the swell of pride at her boyfriend's thoughtfulness.

Natalie appeared visibly moved, clearly reconsidering her previous warnings to Evelyn about being cautious with Preston. The Wall Street tycoon even went so far as to arrange the cutlery, stopping just short of hand-feeding Evelyn.

Heat flooded Evelyn's cheeks. This level of attention would have been embarrassing enough in private, but with Natalie witnessing everything? Did the man possess no sense of restraint?

"Let's eat before it gets cold," Evelyn said quickly, avoiding Preston's gaze.

Natalie took her seat with deliberate calm, arching an eyebrow at Evelyn's flushed face. "You're looking rather feverish yourself. Should we call the doctor back?"

Preston paused mid-motion, studying Evelyn with sudden concern. She shot Natalie a glare. "It's just warm in here. Eat your food."

As Natalie complied with exaggerated innocence, Preston's lips curved into a knowing smile. Had they been alone, he would have teased her mercilessly about that blush.

After the meal, Preston efficiently cleared the containers. Though Evelyn suggested he return home, he refused, equally unwilling to leave her side. He knew better than to ask Evelyn to abandon Isabella, so he settled for catching some rest in the adjacent room.

At dawn, Preston returned with fresh clothes for Evelyn, finding her dozing in a recliner. He hesitated to wake her, content to simply watch - as though memorizing every detail of her peaceful expression.

Isabella's fever had broken overnight, leaving her restless but alert. The first thing she saw upon waking was Preston's lovestruck gaze fixed on Evelyn.

Her groan shattered the tranquil moment. "Must you two be so disgustingly adorable?"

The sound startled both women awake, ending the peaceful interlude.
###Chapter 944

The first rays of dawn painted the hospital room in soft gold when Evelyn Sinclair stirred awake. Beside her, Natalie Beaumont blinked sleep from her eyes. Preston Sinclair's gaze darkened momentarily before clearing.

No irritation touched his features. Even if Isabella Montgomery had disturbed Evelyn's rest, it hadn't been intentional.

Evelyn rose and approached the bed where Isabella lay, her complexion now healthy with color.

Those determined eyes shone bright, though her voice remained frail - likely from hunger. "You're awake? How are you feeling?"

Recognition flickered across Isabella's face as memories resurfaced, dimming her sparkle momentarily.

"I'm starving," she murmured weakly.

Relief washed over Evelyn and Natalie as Preston arranged a meal tray.

While they set up the bedside table, Isabella mumbled, "Alexander isn't here?"

Evelyn froze mid-motion. Isabella bit her lip, eyes glistening.

"I remember him saving me. I wanted to thank him personally."

She'd buried the agony of unrequited love deep. Yet this memory - Alexander protecting her, holding her close for the first time - made her dormant heart flutter awake.

What if...just what if he felt something too? For that slim chance, she'd risk everything.

Evelyn hesitated under Isabella's hopeful gaze.

"Alexander had business, but he'll visit later." She understood Isabella's longing too well to judge. Natalie sighed beside them.

"Darling, you really must sharpen your instincts. Donovan Pierce never seemed trustworthy. I warned you, but you accused me of snap judgments."

Isabella's expression crumpled momentarily. "I was blind. Every kindness I believed came from him was just manipulation."

Her voice dropped to a whisper. "When we were stranded, he had helicopters but refused to use them - afraid his wife would find out. He let me crawl through mud instead. How could I have been so foolish?"

Natalie squeezed her shoulder. "Cut ties completely this time. Consider it a painful lesson learned."

Fury flashed in Isabella's eyes. Evelyn met her gaze steadily. "If you want revenge rather than moving on, we'll help you make him pay."

A Montgomery heiress shouldn't swallow her pride.

Isabella lifted her chin. "I'll tell you if I need help." No false pleasantries between them.

Evelyn smiled as Isabella inhaled deeply. "Alright, I'm eating now. Were you two here all night?"

She blinked at Preston behind Evelyn. "Mr. Sinclair, you stayed too?"

Preston chuckled. "I napped in the adjacent lounge. These two bore the night watch."

Evelyn glanced at him. "You should head to the office. We'll leave soon."

When Preston hesitated, Evelyn clicked her tongue and ushered him out.

"Girl talk incoming. You'll just cramp our style."

Amusement crinkled his eyes. Apparently, he'd been the third wheel.

At the threshold, he turned back suddenly. "Call if you need anything?"

Evelyn nodded impatiently.

Preston's tender smile lingered, reluctance evident in his stance.

Behind Evelyn, Natalie and Isabella's amused stares burned her cheeks.

Recognizing her discomfort, Preston finally relented - but not before catching her hand for one lingering caress.

Heat flooded Evelyn's face. Was Preston Sinclair making a habit of stealing these intimate moments?
###Chapter 945

Before Evelyn could react, Preston Sinclair had already released her hand as if nothing had happened.

He gave a polite nod to the others in the room before turning to leave, a faint smile lingering in his eyes.

His retreating figure was composed, betraying no hint of the subtle gesture he had just made.

Evelyn clicked her tongue in silent amusement before facing the room again.

The moment she turned, she found Isabella Montgomery and Natalie Beaumont grinning at her with knowing looks.

Natalie arched a brow. "Mr. Sinclair moves fast. You two are already this close? Should we expect wedding bells soon?"

Evelyn shot her a warning glance.

"Focus on Isabella's situation, will you? You're missing the point!"

Evelyn straightened, her tone firm.

After Isabella finished her meal, Natalie received an urgent call from her company. Something had come up.

Isabella shook her head. "I can't leave yet. My mother needs to see how miserable I look, or she'll kill me later."

Natalie sighed in exasperation before turning to Evelyn. "Keep an eye on her, then? I have to go."

Evelyn nodded in agreement.

The moment Natalie left, Alexander Sterling arrived.

Evelyn had texted him earlier, informing him of Isabella's condition and suggesting he visit when he had time. She knew Isabella was stubbornly waiting for him—as if demanding some kind of resolution.

Alexander knocked before entering.

Isabella's eyes brightened momentarily, only to dim when she saw who followed him inside.

Evelyn stood, greeting them smoothly. "Alexander, Amelia, you're here."

She hadn't expected Alexander to bring Amelia, but she kept her expression neutral.

Alexander gave a curt nod, his usual detached demeanor intact.

He turned to Isabella. "How are you feeling, Ms. Montgomery?"

Isabella tensed, torn between relief and disappointment. She forced a weak smile. "Much better, thank you."

Evelyn could see the sadness she was trying to hide.

Behind Alexander, Amelia stepped forward, her gentle beauty radiating warmth.

"Wishing you a speedy recovery, Ms. Montgomery."

Isabella managed a faint smile. "Thank you, Amelia. I didn't expect you to visit."

Amelia glanced at Alexander playfully. "My car broke down, so he had to pick me up. I offered to wait outside, but he probably didn’t trust me not to steal his car again."

Alexander shot her an exasperated but fond look.

"After the first two times? I wasn’t taking any chances."

His tone carried unmistakable affection.

Amelia laughed sheepishly.

Though they weren’t physically close, the way they looked at each other softened Alexander’s usual coldness.

Isabella’s smile turned brittle, but she masked it quickly.

She lowered her gaze, shielding the emotions in her eyes.

Evelyn sighed inwardly before speaking lightly.

"Isabella’s fever just broke. She ate a little, but she’s still weak. She needs rest."
###Chapter 946

Alexander Sterling gave a curt nod, his features unreadable.

"Get some rest. If you need assistance with Donovan, ask Evelyn."

Isabella Montgomery's face paled slightly. She pressed her lips together before lifting her gaze to meet his.

"Thank you for your help, Alexander."

His brow furrowed, but he nodded again.

"Don't mention it. You're Evelyn's friend, and our families have business ties. It's only natural."

The light in Isabella's eyes dimmed instantly.

At that moment, she realized how pointless it all was.

Among the countless reasons Alexander had helped her, not one was because she was Isabella.

Of course. What right did she have?

Evelyn Sinclair pursed her lips. "Big Brother, if you and Amelia have work, go ahead. I'll take Isabella home later."

Alexander had no desire to linger. With a final nod, he took Amelia's hand and left.

Before the door closed, Amelia cast a fleeting glance back at Isabella.

But there was no scrutiny in that look—only polite gentleness.

Evelyn shut the door behind them and exhaled.

When she turned back, Isabella's tears had already begun to fall. Evelyn watched as her shoulders trembled silently. Today marked the end of an unrequited love.

"Cry if you need to. I'll take you home after."

Isabella lifted her tear-filled eyes.

"Evelyn… am I really that unworthy? Is that why he won’t even look at me?"

"Of course not."

Isabella drew a shaky breath.

"I never had the courage to say what I wanted. I wasted time with people I didn’t even like. No wonder everyone thinks I’m shallow." She swallowed hard. "I know you meant well. I was the one who hoped for too much. No matter how many years pass, Amelia is still the only one who can move him."

Her voice cracked.

"I give up."

She surrendered.

Her self-indulgent affection had only ever hurt herself. Alexander helped her because of Evelyn. Why keep lying?

She wasn’t the type to fight for someone who didn’t want her. If she were, she wouldn’t have lost her mind over Donovan’s marriage in the first place.

At the thought of Donovan, Isabella wiped her tears, her expression hardening.

"I want to be discharged. Evelyn, I need your help."

Evelyn didn’t hesitate. "Name it."

After eating, Isabella regained enough strength to leave the hospital swiftly.

She took Evelyn to an exclusive club.

"Donovan is signing a contract with Blackwood Industries today. Once it’s finalized, his business will be officially established in San Francisco."

Her grip tightened.

"With Blackwood Industries backing him, he’ll gain power fast. I won’t let that happen."

Evelyn’s stomach dropped.

The moment she heard "Blackwood Industries," she regretted coming.

But it was too late to back out now—Isabella would kill her.

Suppressing her dread, Evelyn followed, mentally cursing her luck.

Please don’t let it be Nathan Blackwood…

Isabella shoved the door open without hesitation.

Inside, over a dozen people sat around a table—lawyers, executives—the atmosphere formal.

All eyes snapped to the interruption.

Isabella scanned the room and found Donovan, frozen in shock.

Her lips curled into a cold smile.

She slammed her bag onto the table with deliberate force.

"Nathan Blackwood, did you even vet this man?" Her voice dripped with disdain. "His liquid assets are falsified. The prices he quoted you are inflated by 20% compared to market rates."

She leaned forward, eyes blazing.

"He’s playing you for a fool."
###Chapter 947

The room fell into stunned silence.

Corporate pricing strategies were highly confidential, known only to those directly involved.

"How could you possibly know this, Ms. Montgomery?"

"Is this information accurate?"

"What's their connection?"

Donovan Pierce quickly regained his composure, fixing Isabella with a murderous glare.

Beside him, a plump woman with sharp features recognized Isabella immediately. She sprang to her feet.

"Ms. Montgomery, wasn't the settlement payment enough for you?"

"Victoria Pierce. What a coincidence."

Victoria looked ready to claw Isabella's eyes out.

Isabella flinched at the word 'homewrecker,' her expression darkening. At that moment, Evelyn Sinclair emerged from the shadows, positioning herself protectively beside her friend.

Her frosty gaze locked onto Victoria.

"Get your facts straight, Mrs. Pierce. Isabella was manipulated into that position. With Donovan's wealth and influence, if he hadn't pursued her relentlessly, she'd never have glanced twice at someone like him. You should leash your dog properly - don't let it bite people then blame them for walking down the street!" Evelyn's words cut like a knife.

Victoria's face twisted with rage.

The assembled guests pretended not to watch, though everyone understood the dynamics at play. With Evelyn present, no one dared openly gawk. Evelyn could feel a familiar intense gaze burning into her from across the room.

She deliberately avoided looking in that direction.

Isabella smirked at the couple, her tone dripping with contempt. "Exactly. I've had my pick of men. Why would I dig through trash? Donovan's the most despicable man I've ever wasted time on. Though I shouldn't be surprised - garbage attracts garbage collectors." The insult couldn't have been clearer.

Just as Isabella turned to leave, Donovan suddenly grabbed her wrist. "We need to talk. Now."

Victoria stood frozen, humiliation and fury warring on her face.

That little witch Isabella had destroyed their business deal, and Donovan didn't even care?

Dragging Isabella away in front of everyone - what message did that send?

It screamed that Victoria's position as Mrs. Pierce meant nothing.

She couldn't let this public humiliation stand.
###Chapter 948

Nathan Blackwood didn't spare Victoria Pierce a single glance. His gaze remained locked on Isabella Montgomery as he dragged her out despite her violent protests.

Evelyn Sinclair's brows knitted together. Fear gripped her at the thought of Donovan Pierce taking Isabella away. She moved to intervene when Nathan's icy voice cut through the tension.

"Harrison." His command sliced through the air. "Inform Mr. Pierce that our contract signing is postponed indefinitely."

He stepped closer to Evelyn. "As thanks, let me treat you to dinner." When she frowned, he added, "Ms. Montgomery included."

Something felt off. Nathan's calm demeanor didn't match the storm she'd witnessed last night. His eyes revealed nothing—dark pools impossible to read.

She forced a polite smile. "We have prior engagements. Another time."

With that, Evelyn turned on her heel and left.

Nathan's expression darkened. A barely perceptible tension gripped his frame before he followed her out. The remaining occupants exhaled in relief—even failed negotiations were preferable to suffocating under Nathan's oppressive presence.

Outside, Evelyn spotted Donovan and Isabella arguing nearby. Isabella's furious gestures suggested she was unleashing every curse in the dictionary. Seeing her friend holding her own, Evelyn hung back.

Harrison waited at a discreet distance.

Before she could settle, Nathan's familiar presence materialized beside her. His voice came low and rough. "Donovan's dangerous. Warn your friend."

Evelyn's face remained impassive. "You don't come up in our conversations."

The words struck like a physical blow. Nathan's entire body stiffened. The carefully controlled storm in his eyes threatened to break free.

Nothing cut deeper than indifference. Nathan felt it viscerally—an invisible hand tearing through his chest, shredding what remained of his composure. Yet he could only endure the pain in silence.
###Chapter 949

Nathan Blackwood studied Evelyn Sinclair's profile—quiet, beautiful, and no longer his.

Dark thoughts festered in his mind. If she wasn't his, should he just destroy her instead?

Evelyn noticed Isabella Montgomery had finished berating Donovan Pierce and waved her over.

Donovan's expression was grim.

A married liar.

This wasn't worth it.

"Ms. Montgomery, President Quimbey has been waiting for you upstairs."

###Chapter 950

Given Mrs. Montgomery’s temper, she might actually beat Isabella senseless.

Mrs. Montgomery ruled the Montgomery family with an iron grip. A formidable woman, she had raised Isabella alone, earning both respect and fear for her unyielding nature.

Ambitious. Ruthless.

Mrs. Montgomery wasn’t giving Isabella a choice.

Last time, she’d helped Isabella escape Gregory Thornton.

That was a battle Isabella would have to fight alone.

Back in her office, a knock interrupted her thoughts.

"President Sinclair," Bennett said, stepping in. "Ms. Amelia Sinclair is here to see you."
###Chapter 951

###Chapter 952

###Chapter 953

Evelyn Sinclair had already slipped into her coat and wrapped her scarf around her neck, standing by the door with her bag in hand.

She moved too quickly.

Preston Sinclair didn’t waste a second, grabbing his belongings to follow her downstairs.

Oliver was dressed in tiny denim overalls and a leather cap, looking every bit the mischievous little troublemaker. His cherubic face was unfairly adorable.
